thread.title: Man Utd transfer news: Dimitar Berbatov sure Zlatan Ibrahimovic will stay | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man Utd transfer news: Dimitar Berbatov sure Zlatan Ibrahimovic will stay | Metro News

author: George Bellshaw For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man Utd transfer news: Dimitar Berbatov sure Zlatan Ibrahimovic will stay | Metro News
text:
George Bellshaw for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 9:47 am 
Dimitar Berbatov believes Zlatan Ibrahimovic will still be at Manchester United next season and believes the Swedish striker has ‘everything he needs’. 
The Bulgarian is a big fan of the 35-year-old, who has scored an impressive 24 goals in 41 appearances for the Red Devils. 
Despite his impressive form, which has also seen him provide five assists, there have been question marks as to whether Ibrahimovic will stay at Old Trafford beyond this season. 
But Berbatov sees no reason why he would leave and is ‘sure he will stay’. 
When asked if he should stay, Berbatov replied: ‘Why not? Will Ibrahimovic stay? (Picture: Getty) 
‘He’s doing great, he’s scoring goals. I’m sure everybody is treating him with the respect he deserves. 
‘He has a great bunch of players around him. The coach, he knows him – they’ve worked together before. 
‘So everything he needs is there. So I’m sure he will stay.’
